items.title: Got a Story About the Justice System in St. Louis? We’re All Ears
items.description: Your input helps us decide what issues The Marshall Project - St. Louis should dig into next.

items.title: Trump’s Executive Order Sows Confusion for Transgender Federal Prisoners
items.description: Without guidance from the Bureau of Prisons, trans people are “told one thing from one staff person and a totally different thing from another.”

items.title: The Marshall Project Announces St. Louis Local News Team
items.description: This will be our third local news team; this one will produce investigative, data and engagement journalism to serve audiences across Missouri.

items.title: How Trump’s Immigration Crackdown Blurs the Lines Between Reality, Rumor and Theater
items.description: ICE arrests, including “collateral arrests,” are up — and often in front of cameras. But experts say the data is incomplete — and hoaxes abound.

items.title: ‘Friendly Signs’ Documentary Follows One Man’s Quest to Create Community for Deaf Prisoners
items.description: Director Rahsaan “New York” Thomas explores the impact of Tommy Wickerd’s sign language class at San Quentin and the challenges of prison filmmaking.
